page.title: 13PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The 150 pupils at Ballymacrickett P.S. encounter a wide variety of subjects. The school is Catholic and religion plays an important part in the formation of religious and moral values. In the present troubled times a positive effort is made to bridge the gap between religious groupings. English and Maths are recognised as priority subjects: History,Geography, Science, Music, Art, Craft, Needlecraft and P.E. are all on the curriculum with varying attainment, and French is introduced in the final year. A B.B.C. Micro is used despite the paucity of good programmes for Primary. School trips to Armagh Planetarium, Ulster Folk Museum, ballet and pantomime have been this year's crop.
